cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Can our ship scan the surface and see anything?
The Artemis is reporting that the magnetic field surrounding Xaxos 7 is still rendering most long-range scans useless.
Still... we might have more luck running a localized scan. Hmmm....
Well don't keep us in suspense. Anything?
Just background noise... chatter from the Federation base... huh. Several mercenary broadcasts coming out of the planet's wastelands.
Wait. That's odd.
You've found something?
Maybe? I'm picking up what sounds like a repeating set of numbers, trillions of digits broadcasting incredibly quickly. This could be them!
Great. Lead on!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Huh... Federation. You're a long way from home.
Cardassians! Although, from the looks of it, not ones allied with their Empire.
Mercenaries! Looks like Janeway's intel about groups of bandits operating on the planet was accurate.

It's too damaged to make out much, but you're right. It's definitely not Federation.
Cardassian maybe? The mercenaries operating in this region might have a ship.
No. I've seen enough of their vessels to know this is something else. And that worries me.
C'mon. The signal is stronger here, so we're moving in the right direction.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I appreciate your response. I had no idea a Federation ship was in the neighborhood.
Have you been trapped here in the Nexus like us?
I’m not sure I follow you…
Burnham, it appears this Janeway and her crew are creations of the Nexus. But they are no doubt our best chance to locate the next reactor.
What’s the situation on the ground?
We have a potential powder keg between us and the Klingon forces on this planet.
Xaxos 7 is a designated neutral territory, claimed by both sides. Both maintain small outposts on the surface but each rarely comes into contact with one another.
The Klingons avoid us, we avoid them, and peace prevails. Until recently, at least. Voyager answered a distress call from the Federation outpost here.
Our probes picked up what appeared to be a Klingon ship approaching the colony . Before we could hail them, it exploded and crashed in neutral territory.
You can understand the sensitive nature of this. We want to know what happened and, if possible, offer assistance.
For all we know this was the prelude to an attack.
Can't you just beam over to the crash site?
As your skip's scanners have probably noticed, any attempt to beam seems distorted by the unique magnetic field of the planet.
Fair enough. If we want to investigate the crash, we'll have to do it on foot.

You are. Come to finish your dirty work?

Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Well, it wasn't us.
If not you... who?

Malfunction!? Hardly. We were on a routine patrol when we encountered a vessel moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
I assume you fought back?
Of course, boy. We fought back hard enough to bring them down as well, but not before they knocked us out of the sky.
Until now I assumed it was the Federation breaking the truce. But... if I'm wrong...
Then there's someone else on the planet. Someone hostile to you... and most likely us.

We need help immediately! A Borg Cube has appeared overhead. We're fighting back but drones are already assimilating hundreds here.
Worse, we've lost communications with Seven of Nine. She has access to all the base's defensive codes!
If they've re-assimilated her, the Borg will be able to use that knowledge to crack us open like an egg!
Focus on saving as many of your troops as you can. We'll find her!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My thanks for the rescue.
Of course. I only regret that you had to suffer at their hands.
It was... instructive.
While I was linked once again to the collective, I saw the breadth of their plans for this planet.
Despite their overwhelming power, the Cube we're fighting is merely a scout ship.
If we fail in destroying it, we risk it alerting the others.
Yeah, we don’t need any more guests at this party.
They'll use Xaxos 7 as a beachhead and devastate the quadrant.
The Cube is too heavily shielded for us to attack directly. Our best approach would be to disable the Cube from within.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold on. I recognize this device.
Oh? Well don't keep us in suspense, man.  What is it?
I believe this is a I data distribution node; an access directly into the Cube’s logs.
Interesting. Let’s see… Huh.  That’s odd.
Something wrong?
Not exactly.  The Node has logs on hundreds of planets all assimilated like they're trying to do with this one.  Then… it looks like they encountered something that bit back.
Another race?
If I'm reading this right it means ‘the Dreamless’.
And after that, everything is scrambled.  All log entries and dates are corrupted and out of place. Measurements are wrong.
Almost as if the laws of physics just collapsed all around them.
Great.  Another mysterious thing to worry about!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm getting a transmission from the Artemis. Reinforcements have arrived!
What?! We just risked life and limb to stop that from happening!
Not theirs, Doctor, ours! The Artemis is reporting waves of Federation and Klingon vessels exiting warp and attacking the cube.
The onslaught is working. The Cube has left low orbit and is starting to retreat back into deep space.
Success?
Indeed! I suggest we start our own retreat!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This place is a maze and its shielding is preventing us from beaming to safety.
I don’t suppose they have a schematic of this place? You know, something they hand out to prospective buyers?
I can connect to one of the data distribution nodes and trace the circuitry it's connected to in order to create a rough layout of the Cube.
Let me see... This is so alien it is almost impossible to understand.
Can we get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We’re getting incoming communication from the Artemis.
They’re saying the Cube is badly damaged. It's rapidly retreating from the attacking fleet.
I suspect the Cube is attempting to return to the Collective physically.
If they manage to do this, the Borg will know the location of the Xaxos 7 and her colonists. We can’t let that happen.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: YOUR EFFORTS ARE FUTILE. ALL WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
This drone must be the Cube's commander.
That isn’t a drone, is… Jean-Luc Picard.
He was captured by the Borg once and assimilated, but we had rescued him! We brought him back!
Snap out of it, man! That's not your captain. Just some nightmare the Nexus has dreamt up.
THERE IS NO DREAMING IN THE COLLECTIVE. WE ARE NOT NIGHTMARES. WE ARE REALITY. SUBMIT.

missions.locDescription: The Borg are retreating back into a Transwarp conduit and attempting to physically contact the Collective.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, aren’t you a resourceful pest?
Someone is transmitting on our comms. I can't block it.
Your machines are already part of the Collective. Your bodies and minds will soon follow.
You may already know, but it bears repeating that resistance is futile. You only need to submit and be fulfilled.
Sounds like you don't know much about the Federation if you simply expect us to roll over on your command!
Roll over, play dead. We are Borg. Your actions have only delayed the inevitable. When we return to the Collective you will be... *hiss*
I've managed to mask our signal for now.
I had heard that voice before, or at least one like it.
It’s now obvious why this Cube is still active. The drones will not rest until we remove their Queen...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Still you scurry around in the shadows, struggling against the inevitable.
I was hoping we'd be able to avoid detection for longer.
She's everywhere, every part of the circuitry around us. We need to keep moving.
To what end, “Worf”?
We like this one - this ”Worf”. Strong and able-bodied. You will make a fine addition to the Collective.
And your mind will reveal much about your race when you're assimilated.
For all her pride in being efficient and cold, she’s pretty fond of theatrics!
She has her drones surrounding us!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s another one of those data nodes. Might be useful, if we’ve got time to scan it, that is.
Step aside, Doctor.  This shouldn't take too long.
Anything useful?
Again, the code’s corrupted like the one we found earlier.
Some sort of virus perhaps? They are similar to synthetics in many ways…
That’s… actually a fairly accurate description of what I'm looking at.
Before the Cube was damaged, everything was normal. Afterwards, it’s jumbled. At first I thought it was just numerology. Dates and distances.
But now? It’s more than that.  The code has bits of random text everywhere. Alien languages unlike anything I've ever seen.
If I didn't know better I'd say it was like the data had been overwritten by thousands of different voices.
Given how these things harvest people, is that so surprising? Maybe their old personalities got free?
Possibly, Doctor.  It’s just… odd. Very odd. And in the Nexus that makes me uncomfortable!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the Cube's warp core!
It's magnificent... and terrifying.
Is it me or is that one of those Nexus Reactors that we’ve been finding?
You’ve come upon more of these, “Doctor McCoy”? I’d be most interested to relieve you of their possession. This one has proven to be an energy source like no other.
The shield just went up behind us!
You don't think we’d want you leaving, do you?
You've shown yourselves to be rare flesh forms. Creative, intelligent and determined.
And your “Artemis” is running a technology that will be a fine addition to the Collective.
The hell it will!
